title: Historical Performance of Johnson Controls International PLC Stock During Economic Recessions and Recoveries

content.section: Background of Johnson Controls International PLC
content.text: Johnson Controls International PLC is an Irish-domiciled multinational conglomerate founded in 1885. The company operates in three major business segments: Building Technologies & Solutions, Power Solutions, and Global Products. It is widely recognized for its expertise in creating sustainable and intelligent buildings, energy storage solutions, and automotive components. Johnson Controls International PLC is publicly traded on the New York Stock Exchange under the ticker symbol JCI.

content.section: The Impact of Economic Recessions on Johnson Controls International PLC Stock
content.text: During economic recessions, companies in the building technologies and automotive sectors often experience significant challenges. Johnson Controls International PLC, being active in both those industries, has observed mixed performance during past recessions.

During the recession that occurred in 1990-1991, Johnson Controls International PLC stock faced a decline of approximately 11% in value. However, it managed to recover swiftly and experienced substantial growth during the subsequent recovery phase.

During the global financial crisis of 2008-2009, Johnson Controls International PLC stock faced a more substantial decline, losing approximately 56% of its value. The company's involvement in the automotive industry, which suffered greatly during that crisis, was a contributing factor. Nevertheless, the stock began recovering following the recession and experienced significant growth in the following years.

content.section: Recession 3, COVID-19 Pandemic, and Current Outlook
content.text: The COVID-19 pandemic and the resulting economic downturn have impacted various sectors, including building technologies and automotive. However, Johnson Controls International PLC stock has shown resilience, experiencing a dip of around 25% in early 2020 but subsequently recovering much of its value.

content.section: Factors Influencing Johnson Controls International PLC Stock Performance
content.text: The performance of Johnson Controls International PLC stock during economic recessions and recoveries can be influenced by various factors. These include the overall economic conditions, consumer and investor sentiment, industry trends, the company's financial health, and its ability to adapt and innovate.

Historically, Johnson Controls International PLC stock has displayed mixed performance during economic recessions, facing declines in some instances but also demonstrating resilience and significant growth during recovery periods. It is crucial to consider the specific circumstances of each recession and the factors driving the overall market conditions to gauge the potential impact on the company's stock performance.

news.headline: JOHNSON CONTROLS TO PRESENT AT THE WOLFE RESEARCH GLOBAL TRANSPORTATION & INDUSTRIALS CONFERENCE
news.summary: Johnson Controls International plc (NYSE: JCI), the global leader for smart, healthy and sustainable buildings, will present at the 17th Annual Wolfe Research Global Transportation & Industrials Conference in New York. Chief Financial Officer, Marc Vandiepenbeeck, will participate on Tuesday, May 21, 2024, at 11:10 a.m. EDT.
